techmeme.title: Meta agrees to pay $1.4B to settle Texas' lawsuit accusing Meta of using facial-recognition tech to collect biometric data of millions of Texans without consent (Reuters)
Microsoft calls on US Congress to pass a comprehensive law to crack down on AI deepfakes that aim to interfere in elections or maliciously target people (Jeff Stone/Bloomberg)
London-based fertility app Flo Health raised a $200M+ Series C from General Atlantic at a $1B+ valuation and expects subscription revenue of over $200M in 2024 (Stephanie Stacey/Financial Times)
Perplexity is launching a program to share ad revenue with partners such as Time, Der Spiegel, Fortune, and WordPress.com, after weeks of plagiarism accusations (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
The UK ICO says the country's election authority failed to take "basic steps" to protect the personal data of 40M people before a 2021 China-backed cyberattack (Rafe Uddin/Financial Times)
